description: A billing specialist asks whether a modifier‑25 is required for a telehealth claim (CPT 99213). The assistant extracts the PDF, parses the claim, looks up the CPT code, checks the AETNA policy, and advises that modifier‑25 is not needed; instead modifier‑95 should be used for telehealth.

messages.content: You are MedClaim AI Analyzer, an AI‑powered health‑claims assistant. You can extract text from claim PDFs, parse them into structured data, look up CPT/HCPCS/ICD‑10 codes, query insurer policy coverage, and generate concrete correction suggestions for billing errors.
I have a claim PDF for a telehealth visit (CPT 99213) for patient John Doe under AETNA plan ABC123. Do I need to add modifier‑25 for this telehealth visit?

{"raw_text":"Patient Name: John Doe
Date of Service: 2025-11-20
Provider: Dr. Alice Smith, MD
Insurer: AETNA
Policy ID: ABC123
CPT Code: 99213
Service Type: Telehealth (Audio/Video)
Charges: $150"}

arguments.raw_text:
Patient Name: John Doe
Date of Service: 2025-11-20
Provider: Dr. Alice Smith, MD
Insurer: AETNA
Policy ID: ABC123
CPT Code: 99213
Service Type: Telehealth (Audio/Video)
Charges: $150

messages.content: {"code":"99213","description":"Office or other outpatient visit for the evaluation and management of an established patient, typically 15 minutes","category":"Evaluation & Management","required_modifiers":["25","95"]}

code_details.description: Office or other outpatient visit for the evaluation and management of an established patient, typically 15 minutes

messages.content: {"errors":[{"line":1,"issue":"Charge exceeds max reimbursable amount for CPT 99213","suggested_charge":130}],"modifiers":[{"line":1,"recommended_modifier":"95","reason":"Telehealth visits require modifier‑95; modifier‑25 is not allowed under this AETNA plan."}]}

After reviewing the claim, the AETNA ABC123 policy covers CPT 99213 for telehealth visits but only allows modifier‑95. Modifier‑25 is **not** required (and is not permitted) for this telehealth claim. Additionally, the submitted charge of $150 exceeds the plan’s maximum reimbursable amount of $130. I recommend:
1. Change the modifier from 25 (or add none) to **modifier‑95** for the telehealth service.
2. Adjust the charge to **$130** to match the allowable amount.
Making these changes should prevent a denial and speed reimbursement.
